title.narrative: Assessing available corporate disclosure data for determining nature-related risks and opportunities

description.narrative:
Activities
Kick-off meeting to agree definition and para meters of the research Selection of questions and data points from 2021 CDP forest questionnaire and undertake some mapping to TCFD Categorize relevant risks, opportunities, and impacts into groups Analysis the drop-down responses and open text fields to each question as well as number of companies reporting Perform a regional and primary industry analysis of risk and response Report on question structure (open field matrix, matrix, dropdown options) of the relevant questions to make a clear how the data is gathered Prep and write up two x company case studies (two days per case study) First draft report preparation including method and questionnaires explanation, number and %s and what the data is showing High and overview/gap/limitations analysis of nature related risks, opportunities, and impacts across CDP's three themes (climate, water, and forest), expanded to TNFD recommendations Monthly meetings phase one Final report preparation, integrating gap analysis Presentation of final report to Global Canopy Final report preparation integrating feedback from Global Canopy Grant and financial management and reporting

The subgrantee will develop a research report which highlights relevant data currently being captured by global disclosure systems (e.g., CDP) for the assessment, measurement and disclosure of nature-related risks and opportunities in palm oil and where possible other forest risk commodity supply chains. The report must capture information relevant to Palm Oil supply chains as it will help feed into technical guidance being developed as part of a Global Canopy led TNFD-Aligned Palm Oil Pilot.
This will be part of a series of supporting research pieces for the TNFD-Aligned Palm Oil Pilot which all aim to provide useful insights for the wider formal TFND development process.
